metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7446 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in net/unix/af_unix.c in the Linux kernel before 4.3.3 allows local users to bypass intended AF_UNIX socket permissions or cause a denial of service (panic) via crafted epoll_ctl calls. It was discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the AF_UNIX implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use crafted epoll_ctl calls to cause a denial of service (system crash) or expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.3.0-5-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-generic-lpae - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-lowlatency - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-powerpc-e500mc - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-powerpc-smp - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-powerpc64-emb - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-4.3.0-5-powerpc64-smp - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-extra-4.3.0-5-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-5.16').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.4').
linux-signed package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-5.16').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
